block.p: Jacqueline Deborah Glassenberg, the daughter of Judith and Albert Glassenberg of New London, Conn., was married at her parents' house last evening to Damon John Hemmerdinger, the son of Elizabeth and H. Dale Hemmerdinger of New York. Attorney General Richard Blumenthal of Connecticut officiated.

Mrs. Hemmerdinger, 27, is a freelance photographer and a director of Generation Harvest, the young professionals' group of City Harvest, the antihunger organization in New York. She graduated from New York University. Her father, who is retired, owned the New London News Company, a former wholesaler and distributor of publications to newsstands.

Jacqueline Glassenberg, Damon Hemmerdinger Jacqueline Deborah Glassenberg, the daughter of Judith and Albert Glassenberg of New London, Conn., was married at her parents' house last evening to Damon John Hemmerdinger, the son of Elizabeth and H. Dale Hemmerdinger of New York. Attorney General Richard Blumenthal of Connecticut officiated.

Jacqueline Deborah Glassenberg, the daughter of Judith and Albert Glassenberg of New London, Conn., was married at her parents' house last evening to Damon John Hemmerdinger, the son of Elizabeth and H. Dale Hemmerdinger of New York. Attorney General Richard Blumenthal of Connecticut officiated.

Mrs. Hemmerdinger, 27, is a freelance photographer and a director of Generation Harvest, the young professionals' group of City Harvest, the antihunger organization in New York. She graduated from New York University. Her father, who is retired, owned the New London News Company, a former wholesaler and distributor of publications to newsstands.

Mr. Hemmerdinger, 30, is a consultant and principal at Amenta & Company in New York, a consulting concern on the redevelopment of retail space. He is also a director of Leadership, Education and Athletics in Partnership in New Haven, which provides after-school and summer programs for children in Connecticut. He graduated magna cum laude from Williams College and received a law degree from Yale.

His father is the president of Atco Properties and Management, a New York-based owner, manager and developer of residential and commercial property. He is also a trustee of N.Y.U. and chairman of its fund-raising and alumni affairs committees, and a vice chairman of the Police Foundation and the Real Estate Foundation, both in New York. The bridegroom's mother is the secretary to the board of Atco and a playwright. The Hemmerdinger family owns the Atlas restaurant on Central Park South.
